rComments: Hard class for me but didn't think it was because of his teaching ability. He always answers questions well, but it seems like he has trouble remembering not everyone has a PhD in dead ocean stuff. Still enjoyed the class though, the lab s great.
Matthew is one of the greatest persons in the Earth Science department at UCSC. I will be infinitively thankful for his help and dedication. He is also very, very funny!

Worst class I've taken. Nothing was explained well or written down anywhere. No textbook. Went into office hours to get better understanding, but still ended up with a poor grade. Waste of time. Lectures were long and boring, but interesting subject if anything. Terrible lab ta too. Rude as hell

Terrible!  This class had no prerequisites, so I took it hoping to be able to keep up.  He treated us like we had all already taken the Summer Field Course and gave us little to no instruction on how to get decent grades on our projects.  I spent 12 hours on the first project and got a 54/100.

Matt is cool, but this class was awful. His lectures were confusingly structured, and he wasted so much time with useless in-class worksheets. The first essay was fine, but the following two were not explained WHATSOEVER, and he seemed surprised when the class average was 50%. His expectations given how little he had taught us were unrealistic.

I really enjoyed having Matthew as a Professor. He is a great lecture and very engaging in class. That said I would not recommend anyone take this class. The paper are ridiculously hard and there is very little info provided on what he expects you to write about. Most of my time was devoted to this class to the point where my other grades suffered.

Clapham is very knowledgeable! He tries to be clear as possible in his lectures; yet, he can be more helpful during his office hours. Unless you're keenly observant, the labs are torture. Overall, study days before the exams, and you're guaranteed to succeed in his class.

He is so adorable, he looks like  a college student. the class was boring, and i personally took teh class as a G.E. so i avoided it constantly, only went when needed or would leave early, his midterm&final are somewhat difficult so study the questions he gives at the end of each lecture. not so hard but you do need to memorize like 90 questions

The Professor is fairly nice, but the lectures are overly-complicated and his grading on exams leaves something to be desired. He wants answers that are exactly as he said them, not even what he puts up on his powerpoint slides. Labs are mandatory and he grades lab assignments very similarly to his exams. It's all rote memorization.

Matt is cute! (in an Adam Brody sort of way)... The class average was really low and I don't understand why.  The lectures were only important to attend to get the questions he gave at the end. Both the midterm and the final were composed of short answers Qs taken straight from class. Slides and podcasts were posted.

Matthew Clapham is a very smart and helpful professor. His office hours are extremely helpful. Yet, as easy as he makes the material sound, just as hard are the midterm and final. You need to study tremendously to earn a decent grade--unless you're willing to study your life away and be stuck with all these very-hard labs, take his class.

the ease of the class made it seem like it'd be easy, but it wasn't. labs are mandatory, lectures are not (lecture slides and recorded podcast online). questions given at end of class for midterm and final (not online). labs were hard, material was hard. would not recommend unless you like being bored and challenged.

Clapham is awesome.  He has a nerdy/entertaining sense of humor, really enjoys and has a passion for his subject.  I had the benefit of having him lead my discussion as well and he was really helpful during it.  Midterm+final were based on ?s he posted at the end of lecture (otherwise slides are online) so attendance was encouraged not mandatory.

Nice guy, super passionate about his work, extremely knowledgeable.  He can go off on tangents a lot. Midterm and Final require A LOT of studying, average on the midterm was 60% and he doesn't curve.  Good Luck!

hes cute in a nerd way, and he is very knowledgeable in what he is teaching, he gets really into his lectures, his notes and lectures are available online, so class is not mandatory, his midterm and final are based on questions he gives after every lecture, its pretty easy, and he is very helpful but also very picky in the rigth answers on his test
GREAT professor. He knows a lot about many different subjects and is always willing to help a student out. He makes his lectures fun with his jokes and comments. Take any of his classes!

He doesnt explain alternative perspectives in science. He's a little biased and opinionated. He states a lot of scientific terms and doesn't really explain them. He thinks the students are dumb. He's nerdy but in a cute way.

Major nerd with a nerdy sense of humor, looks like he is 17 years old, a good teacher,  has a great deal of knowledge pertaining to subject matter, tests are bearable, come to class, take decent notes and the class is a breeze
